page.content: { BROCKWORTH,1086 DOMESDAY SURVEY.} Hugo Lasne held "Brockowardinge in Dudeston Hundred of the King".There were 5 hides (acreage of arable land). The Demense or personal estate of the Lord of Brockworth had two plough teams, and the rest of the inhabitants between them had 15. Eight villeins & 6 bordars each had different degrees of servitude to the lord, the serfs being little more than slaves. There was a priest,hence there must have been a church, but that is not recorded.There were also 2 freemen and a bailiff. The Commissioners recorded the woodland groves and copses as a triangle roughly one league in length and half a league in breadth. A mill was mentioned, marked now as Mill Farm and was worth 2 shillings a year.Total value of Parish was Â£5.
